text: Legislative elections were held in the German Democratic Republic on 14 November 1971. 434 deputies to the Volkskammer were elected, with all of them being candidates of the single-list National Front. 584 Front candidates were put forward, with 434 being elected. The allocation of seats remained unchanged from previous elections. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right !rowspan=2|Alliance !rowspan=2|Party !rowspan=2|Votes !rowspan=2|% !colspan=4|Seats |- !Directly elected !Indirectly elected !Total !+/– |- |rowspan=9 align=left|National Front||align=left|Socialist Unity Party of Germany||rowspan=9|11,207,388||rowspan=9|99.8||110||17||127||0 |- |align=left|Free German Trade Union Federation||60||8||68||0 |- |align=left|Christian Democratic Union||45||7||52||0 |- |align=left|Liberal Democratic Party of Germany||45||7||52||0 |- |align=left|National Democratic Party of Germany||45||7||52||0 |- |align=left|Democratic Farmers' Party of Germany||45||7||52||0 |- |align=left|Free German Youth||35||5||40||0 |- |align=left|Democratic Women's League of Germany||30||5||35||0 |- |align=left|Cultural Association of the GDR||19||3||22||0 |- |colspan=2 align=left|Against||16,951||0.2||–||–||–||– |- |colspan=2 align=left|Invalid/blank votes||3,196||–||–||–||–||– |- |colspan=2 align=left|Total||11,227,535||100||434||66||500||0 |- |colspan=2 align=left|Registered voters/turnout||11,401,090||98.5||–||–||–||– |- |colspan=8 align=left|Source: IPU |} ==References== * Inter-Parliamentary Union: HISTORICAL ARCHIVE OF PARLIAMENTARY ELECTION RESULTS - Germany Category:1971 in East Germany 1971 Category:1971 elections in Germany Category:November 1971 events in Europe East Germany
title: 1971 East German general election
